ARABIC: ٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا۟ لَكَ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ فَضَلُّوا۟ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Look how they make likenesses of you and go astray. They are unable to find their way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: See, what comparisons they coin for you, and go astray, and thus cannot find the way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Just see how strange are the things they invent about you. They have altogether strayed, and are unable to find the right way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Consider what they have called you. They have certainly gone astray and cannot find the right path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: See the kind of examples they invent for you! They therefore strayed, so cannot find a path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: See what examples they have put forward for you. So they have gone astray, and never can they find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: See what they liken you to! So they have gone astray and cannot find the way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Behold, how they strike similitudes for thee, and go astray, and cannot find a way!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: See what similitudes they coin for thee, and thus are all astray, and cannot find a road!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: See to what they liken you! But they are lost and cannot find the right path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Behold! how they propound similitudes for thee! They have strayed and cannot find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Look, how they coin epithets for you; so they go astray, and cannot find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: See what similes they strike for thee: but they have gone astray, and never can they find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: See what examples they have put forward for you. So they have gone astray, and never can they find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: See what they compared you to. They have surely gone astray and cannot find a Path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Note what they compared you to. They are lost, and unable to find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [17:48] God, exalted be He, says: Look how they strike similitudes for you, such as [your being] bewitched, a soothsayer or a poet, and they go astray, thereby from [the path of] guidance, and cannot find a way, a path to it!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (See) Muhammad (what similitudes they coin for thee) how they liken you to a bewitched person, (and thus are all astray) and thus are wrong in what they say, (and cannot find a road!) out of what they said; and it is also said that this means: they cannot find a proof from what they say.
